Germany hosts peace talks between Armenia and AzerbaijanGermany is hosting two days of peace talks between Azerbaijan and Armenia five months after Azerbaijan recaptured its Karabakh region from its ethnic Armenian majority, prompting a mass exodus of ethnic Armenians. Wed, 28 Feb 2024 10:22:41 GMT RBCJGIQQBNIGRLIOARG4BRHXI4 https://www.reuters.com/world/germany-hosts-peace-talks- Between-armenia-azerbaijan-2024-02-28/Reuters世界
Israel presses on with settlement plans despite US criticismIsraeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich pledged to continue expanding settlements in the occupied West Bank, defying international pressure on Israel to stop building on land Palestinians see as the core of a future independent state. Wed, 28 Feb 2024 10:19:02 GMT KKGSNWKPPJKQRB5RLMUSQ5FB3Y https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israel-presses-with-settlement-plans-despite-us-criticism-2024-02-28/Reuters世界中东
Alexei Navalny's funeral to be held on Friday in Moscow - spokespersonRussian opposition leader Alexei Navalny's funeral service and burial will take place in Moscow on Friday, his spokesperson said, after a search for a hall to allow his supporters to bid farewell to him failed. Wed, 28 Feb 2024 10:01:09 GMT BTJ4VSYYTFITXKVWPYDPTLRJYM https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/alexei-navalnys-funeral-be-held-friday-moscow-spokesperson-2024-02-28/Reuters世界欧洲
South Korea to send military doctors to hospitals amid doctors' protestSouth Korea will send its military and community doctors to hospitals within the next few days as part of emergency measures to support the healthcare system after a mass walkout by trainee doctors, Prime Minister Han Duck-soo said on Wednesday. Australia intelligence chief reveals details of foreign spy operationAustralia's spy chief revealed details of a foreign intelligence service's efforts to target Australians for information in an annual speech on Wednesday and said his agency had confronted the spy masters to let them know they had been caught. Russia jails Ukrainian man for 11-1/2 years for attempting to buy secret missile partsA court in southern Russia has jailed a Ukrainian man for 11-1/2 years after convicting him of espionage for trying to procure secret missile components for Ukraine, Russian news agencies reported on Wednesday.
